result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Lee Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge: to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by  12/29/2014 .  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence.

Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Lee Cotton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing JANUARY 13, 2014 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to PUBLIC DEFENDER TERESE DICK, 819 N. 6TH STREET.

Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for FIVE  YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of THREE YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of TWO YEARS, concurrent  to any other sentence, credit for 302 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12-29-14; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12-29-14; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On court's own motion  case adjourned  due to other jury trials.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. lr
  Jury trial scheduled for 10-29-2014 at 08:30 am.
State filed winess list; proposed jury instructions; motion in limine. lr
Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Devon Lee Cotton not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains on for jury trial in branch 47. lr

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Benjamin J Peirce in court, defendant Devon Lee Cotton not in court, in custody.  Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

New counsels request for a final pretrial date and a jury trial date is granted by the court.  Parties are advised that effective 08-03-14 this case will be transfered to Branch 47 Judge Siefert.  Scheduling order signed and filed.  Case is adjourned for final pretrial.  Jury trial scheduled for 08-20-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in custody. Randy Sitzberger for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense received new discovery and todays date. Defense counsel believes there has been a breakdown in communication with the defendant. Court grants Attorney Dick's motion to withdraw. Case calendared for STATUS of COUNSEL on 6/13/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held.  Parties requested another final pre-trial. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 06/09/2014 in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions received and filed.
Defense Motion in Limine received and filed.

Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial, case remains in trial posture.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 06/09/2014 in Branch 15, however parties are requesting an additional final pre-trial for possible resolution.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M Dick in court, defendant Devon Lee Cotton not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense does not intend to file a Speedy Trial Demand.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 5-15-2014 and for jury trial on 6-9-2014 in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 05-15-2014 at 08:30 am.

Original Transcript (15 pages) commencing 1-13-2014 PRELIMINARY HEARING received and filed.
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Terese Dick 819 N 6th Street.

Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF2983 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Kenton Burtch-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marcques D.

Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Devon Lee Cotton in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
